data.headline: S&P 500 rally faded after a robust January jobs report pushed Treasury yields higher and reduced expectations for near-term Fed rate cuts
bullets: Dow, S&P 500, and small caps all traded modestly lower mid-session, while the Nasdaq led declines on software and tech sector weakness
Rotation out of growth, AI, and small cap stocks intensified as traders reassessed risk appetite
Post-earnings slumps weighed on Lyft, Robinhood, Mattel, Moderna, Cloudflare, Ford, Zillow, and Humana
Deficit concerns and rising yields contributed to increased market volatility
Traders monitored ongoing earnings from Coca-Cola and Marriott for further market direction
Kraft Heinz shares moved after the company scrapped breakup plans
Market participants remained focused on tomorrowâ€™s CPI release and the search for a 'Goldilocks' economic scenario
